author: Nikhila Henry
text:
MHRD appoints M. Periasamy to the post with immediate effect

P. Appa Rao, Vice-Chancellor of the University of Hyderabad (UoH) who was forced to go on leave following the row triggered by the suicide of Dalit research scholar Rohith Vemula, has now lost the position as Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the National Commission of Rural Institutes (NCRI), which he has been holding since January 7 this year.

The Ministry of Human Resource Development on Wednesday appointed M. Periasamy, in-charge Vice Chancellor of UoH, to the post with immediate effect. The Ministry’s decision was communicated to UoH’s administrative office by fax. “As the in-charge CEO and Chancellor of NCRI, I will visit the institute on February 4 to take charge,” Prof. Periasamy confirmed.

Prof. Rao was holding additional charge of NCRI even after he went on leave on January 24. As the 15-year-old NCRI has not had a permanent chairman for long, the V-C of UoH is often asked to hold additional charge of the plum post.

According to sources, Prof. Appa Rao is not expected to come back to the V-C’s office till the completion of enquiry.
title: Appa Rao removed as NCRI chairman
